intro: Protium maestrense, commonly known as the Caribbean satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, resinous sap. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing aromatic seeds. Its bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Protium maestrense plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
